segments.text: You know , I really don ’ t think Americans are very romantic .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Where did you get that idea ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s the impression I get from the movies , and from looking around . Men and women seem very business-like in their relations with each other .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I ’ m still not sure what you ’ re asking me .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is it true or isn ’ t it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you want to know something about the American character ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I just think you ’ re trying to change the subject . But go ahead .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , this will help answer your question . In American society boys and girls are raised together . They ’ re not segregated in their activities ! Boys and girls go out together from an early age .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: After being raised together , men and women can be business-like in each other ’ s company . It really doesn ’ t have anything to do with the way a man and woman behave toward each other when they are in love . Does that answer your question ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Not exactly , but I see your point .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think Americans are pretty romantic when they are in a relationship and a lot of flirting goes on in every office . After you ’ Ve been in America for a while , you will probably see what I mean .
segments.speaker: S2
